questionTitle: Point out the wrong statement.
questionOption1: All push technologies used in mobile applications are server-based
questionOption2: Push email is the penultimate example of a push service
questionOption3: In push email, the service is always connected to the client, and it sends out to the client more or less immediately any new email that arrives at the server
questionExplanation: Not all push technologies used in mobile applications are server-based.

questionTitle: _________ is a cloud computing service model in which hardware is virtualized in the cloud.
questionExplanation: In this particular model, the service vendor owns the equipment: servers, storage, network infrastructure, and so forth.

questionTitle: Point out the correct statement.
questionOption1: Some mature SOA implementations favor orchestration over choreography
questionOption2: Most mature SOA implementations favor choreography over orchestration
questionOption3: With orchestration, multiple service manages the various processes
questionExplanation: Most mature SOA implementations favor orchestration over choreography.

questionTitle: Which of the following is not an OASIS standard for SOA Security?
questionExplanation: SMIL (Synchronized Multimedia Integration Language), is a language that allows Web site creators to be able to easily define and synchronize multimedia applications.

questionTitle:
Which of the following architecture is shown in the following figure?
Service Oriented Modelling practice
Modelling Environments
Modelling Solutions
Best Practices
questionExplanation: A service in SOMF that is granular and very narrow in scope is referred to as an atomic service.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the largest Chinese social networking site?
questionExplanation: ResearchGATE is used for science research.

questionTitle: Point out the correct statement.
questionOption1: The UML standard is the work of the Object Management Group
questionOption2: SysML creates graphical representations of software systems in the form of a set of diagram types
questionOption3: UML diagrams are separated into four structural types and seven behavior types
questionExplanation: UML diagrams are separated into seven structural types and four behavior types.

questionTitle: Which of the following element is a non-relational storage system for large-scale storage?
questionExplanation: Azure Storage Service lets you create drives, manage queues, and store BLOBs.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a complementary mechanism to OpenID and is used to create SSO systems?
questionExplanation: Taken as a unit, OpenID and SAML are being positioned to be the standard authentication mechanism for clients accessing cloud services.

questionTitle: Which of the following aspect of the service is abstracted away?
questionExplanation: With the exception of the user interaction with the software, all other aspects of the service are abstracted away.

questionTitle: Which of the following applications are processed locally on the phone?
questionExplanation: Smartphones are essentially miniaturized computers which run locally.

questionTitle: Point out the correct statement.
questionOption1: To use a Web service, a device do not need to know about that service and know-how to access it
questionOption2: Mobile devices can transmit specific information about the condition of the device and its user
questionOption3: Pull services are an important mechanism in e-mail and in certain forms of publishing
questionExplanation: This information, when properly parsed and logically analyzed, can be used to create context-aware services.

questionTitle: Which of the following standard uses the same authorization and authentication mechanism as CDMI?
questionExplanation: CDMI includes commands that allow applications to access cloud storage and create, retrieve, update, and delete data objects.

questionTitle: Which of the following is an industry organization that develops industry system management standards for platform interoperability?
questionExplanation: DMTF stands for Distributed Management Task Force.

questionTitle: Point out the wrong statement.
questionOption1: Large cloud providers with geographically dispersed sites worldwide, therefore, achieve reliability rates that are hard for private systems to achieve
questionOption2: Private data centers tend to be located in places where the company or unit was founded or acquired
questionOption3: A network backbone is a very low-capacity network connection
questionExplanation: On the Internet, an Internet backbone consists of the high-capacity routes and routers that are typically operated by an individual service provider such as a government or commercial entity.

questionTitle: Which of the following is the management console in AWS?
questionExplanation: Pods are managed by a Cloud Control System (CCS).

questionTitle: Which of the following performance analysis tool lets you save its state for Windows?
questionExplanation: In the Amazon Web Service, the statistics monitoring tool is called Amazon CloudWatch, and you can create a performance monitoring console from the statistics it collects.

questionTitle: The costs associated with resources in the cloud computing model _______ can be unbundled to a greater extent than the costs associated with CostDATACENTER.
questionExplanation: The CostDATACENTER consists of the summation of the cost of each of the individual systems with all the associated resources.

questionTitle: Which of the following is a push mechanism for publishing Web site data that is device-specific?
questionExplanation: WAP stands for Wireless Access Protocol.

questionTitle: Point out the correct statement.
questionOption1: QoS levels may be applied to different services against a single virtual storage container
questionOption2: An SLA might specify that a particular Quality of Service (QoS) for a virtual storage container may be measured in terms of the I/O per second
questionOption3: To provide for scaling, a virtual storage container must be easily migrated from one storage system to another
questionExplanation: One unique characteristic of cloud-based storage solutions is that they permit rapid scaling, both in terms of performance and storage capacity.

questionTitle: Which of the following will be the host operating system for Windows Server?
questionExplanation: Type 2 virtual machines are installed over a host operating system.

questionTitle: Which of the following operating system support operating system virtualization?
questionExplanation: This type of virtualization creates virtual servers at the operating system or kernel level.

questionTitle: The _______ Open Source Identity Framework is used to create a vendor-neutral cloud-based authentication service.
questionExplanation: The Higgins Open Source Identity Framework uses an i-Card metaphor.

questionTitle: Point out the wrong statement.
questionOption1: Everything from the application down to the infrastructure is the vendor’s responsibility
questionOption2: In the deployment model, different cloud types are an expression of the manner in which infrastructure is deployed
questionOption3: AaaS provides virtual machines, operating systems, applications, services, development frameworks, transactions, and control structures
questionExplanation: PaaS provides virtual machines, operating systems, applications, services, development frameworks, transactions, and control structures.

questionTitle: Which of the following platform features are used in Windows 7 by Microsoft?
questionExplanation: Applications for Windows Phone 7 are based on the .NET Compact Framework 4, XNA, and Silverlight Applications.

questionTitle: A _______ image makes a copy or a clone of the entire computer system inside a single container such as a file.
questionExplanation: The system imaging program is used to make this image and can be used later to restore a system image.

questionTitle: __________ authentication requires the outside use of a network security or trust service.
questionExplanation: More secure authentication requires the use of at least two-factor authentication.

questionTitle: How many types of security boundary values exist in Cloud Cube model?
questionExplanation: There are two types depending upon network firewall.

questionTitle: Which of the following is also referred to edge computing?
questionExplanation: In edge computing, content is pushed out geographically so the data is more readily available to network clients and has a lower latency when requested.

questionTitle: Which of the following domain is used to create sites that render correctly on mobile devices?
questionExplanation: This domain is a sponsored domain and was created by a group of companies in the mobile space.
